page.title: 01Downland SW of Chiseldon
page.content: The landscape is a chalk plateau rising gently towards the south. Land use is almost completely agricultural with larger than average fields and few hedges. This, together with the predominant growth of cereals, has led to it being described as the "Wiltshire Prairies". The principle village is Chiseldon which, with its outlying hamlets, has a population of approx.2500. Many of these commute to the industrial and commercial concerns in and around Swindon. Princess Alexandra's Royal Air Force Hospital, Wroughton is established to the west of the block and serves all three arms of the forces and also accepts civilian patients from the locality. Running across the block is the Ridgeway ancient trackway, now used as a long distance walk. A large tract of land
